attributes.action: Give Every Woman The Right To Become A Mother Through IVF On The NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
IVF on the NHS 
NHS trusts across England and Wales are working to provide the same levels of service. However, the provision of IVF treatment varies across the country and often depends on local CCG policies. 

CCGs may have additional criteria you need to meet before you can have IVF on the NHS, such as:
•not having any children already, from both your current and any previous relationships 
•being a healthy weight 
•not smoking 
•falling into a certain age range
attributes.background: In 2012, we lost our baby at 20 weeks pregnant. After being under a consultant on the NHS for 2 years in November 2015 we were told because my husband has 2 children they can't do anymore for us. All I want is to be a mother due to having endometriosis falling pregnant naturally is difficult.
